content: this is a summary of a legal case in slovenia the supreme court made a decision on august 24 2017 but the text does not provide details about the parties or the case the legal procedure involved a cost procedure a first instance judgment and a review by the supreme court the dispute was about the division of business premises and land between cohabitating partners the court of appeal made a decision about the costs which was reviewed by the supreme court and dismissed the court used laws related to marriage and family relations to make a decision the defendants were unable to prove their claim about the purchase of the property so the court rejected their objection the court ruled that the property was coowned by the plaintiff the applicant filed an application for revision but it was dismissed the court found that the applicant lived with the defendants and they jointly purchased properties the court of second instance upheld the judgment of the court of first instance the defendants have now filed a new appeal the court made a decision in the first instance based on a violation of the civil procedure act the court of second instance dismissed the appeal because the circumstances did not affect the correctness of the decision the court of first instance set aside the judgment and referred the case for a retrial the applicant filed an application for revision but it was found to be unfounded the supreme court reviewed the judgment and found no procedural errors the court rejected the appeal and ordered the applicant to bear the costs of the review proceedings
